abstracts.cdata!:
This resettlement action plan, provides
            a policy framework for compensation, and rehabilitation to
            project affected persons (PAPs), resulting from
            implementation of the Agricultural Development Program
            Project. Within the legal framework, it reviews the
            provision for partial resettlement, resulting from an
            inventory, and socioeconomic survey, which envisage
            compensation, and entitlement of payments, for
            rehabilitation, costs, and funding sources, while full
            resettlement will be prepared in accordance with the
            National Project Office (NPO), and the Bank. Institutional
            arrangements stipulate that the NPO shall be responsible for
            implementing policy plans, ensuring compensation,
            rehabilitation, and resettlement activities are provided
            accordingly. Mitigation measures specify that: 1)
            agricultural land, and crop losses will be compensated
            through "land for land" arrangements of equal
            productive capacity, and, loss of standing crops, fruits,
            and trees, at market values. Temporary land losses will be
            compensated for lost income, standing crops, and for the
            cost of soil restoration, and damaged infrastructure for a
            period up to two years; 2) residential land, and structures
            losses, will be equivalently replaced if possible, or, cash
            compensation should replace losses without depreciation;
            and, 3) commercial land, structures, and business losses,
            shall be replaced by alternative business, or commercial
            sites, of equal size if possible, or, cash compensation
            should reflect full replacement costs, including cash for
            lost income during the transition period. Grievance
            mechanisms shall be in place, followed by monitoring and
            evaluation practices, to ensure adequate resettlement implementation.
